summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between attorneys for Prince Andrew, the Duke of York (Gary Bloxsome and Daniel Cundy of Blackfords LLP) and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York. It details negotiations over the Duke's potential cooperation with the U.S. investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, with his lawyers offering a written witness statement and written Q&A but resisting a voluntary in-person or video interview.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.role: Partner at Blackfords LLP, legal representative for the Duke of York
persons.context: Primary author of the emails, negotiating the terms of Prince Andrew's potential cooperation with the U.S. Attorney's Office. He offers a written witness statement and written answers but pushes back against a live interview.

persons.name: Daniel Cundy
persons.role: Partner at Blackfords LLP, legal representative for the Duke of York
persons.context: Co-author on emails, sends reference materials regarding legal procedures and protections to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jennifer Richardson
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence among the Duke of York's legal team and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: The Duke of York
persons.role: Client of Blackfords LLP, subject/witness in U.S. investigation
persons.context: Prince Andrew, whose legal team is negotiating the terms under which he would provide information to the U.S. investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the pending U.S. criminal indictment (1994-1997) to which Prince Andrew's potential testimony relates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Mentioned as an associate of Ghislaine Maxwell and someone Prince Andrew had an association with, relevant to the investigation.

connections.description: Bloxsome is a partner at Blackfords LLP and is acting as legal counsel, negotiating on behalf of the Duke.
Cundy is a partner at Blackfords LLP and is part of the legal team representing the Duke.
The Duke is described as having an association with Maxwell, and the investigation seeks his knowledge about her.
The Duke is described as having an association with Epstein, relevant to the investigation.
Partners at the same law firm (Blackfords LLP) working together on the Duke of York's case.

events.title: Indictment Period for Ghislaine Maxwell

locations: 15 Old Bailey, London, EC4M 7EF (Blackfords LLP office)
St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
Hill House, 1 Mint Walk, Croydon, CRO 1EA (Blackfords LLP registered address)
keyFacts: Prince Andrew's UK lawyers offered that he would provide a written witness statement and answer relevant questions in writing for the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation, but resisted a voluntary in-person or video interview.
The U.S. Attorney's Office had explicitly stated they regarded Prince Andrew not as a witness but as a 'subject' of their investigation, a point of concern for his legal team.
The Duke's lawyers sought to limit questioning to the period of the Maxwell indictment (1994-1997) and demanded strict confidentiality, preventing sharing with complainants or in civil matters.
The email chain reveals a tense negotiation, with the U.S. side pressing for a full interview and broader scope, and the UK side offering a compromise based on UK legal practice.
